src: Pastikan tangan dalam keadaan serileks mungkin sambil tetap menekan setiap nada dengan benar - Upayakan jari tidak membuat banyak gerakan ekstra. Dengan cara ini, Anda akan mengurangi rasa lelah Anda. Ingatlah bahwa tidak perlu menekan tuts terlalu keras untuk mendapatkan volume ekstra seperti pada piano. Di akordion, untuk mendapatkan volume lebih besar, Anda menggunakan ububan dengan tekanan atau kecepatan lebih besar.
mt: 1. Make sure your hands are as relaxed as possible while still pressing each note correctly - Try to keep your fingers from making unnecessary movements. This will help reduce fatigue. Remember that you don't need to press the keys too hard to get extra volume like on a piano. On an accordion, to get a louder volume, you use bellows with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Salah satu masalah paling umum saat mencoba mengonversi film ke format DVD adalah overscan. Kebanyakan televisi dibuat untuk menyenangkan publik pada umumnya. Karena itulah, segala yang terlihat di TV memiliki batas-batas pada sisi atas, bawah, dan samping yang dipotong. Hal ini dilakukan untuk memastikan gambar menutupi seluruh layar. Hal tersebut dinamakan overscan. Sayangnya, saat Anda membuat DVD, bagian tepinya mungkin akan terpotong, dan jika terdapat teks yang terlalu ke bawah, maka teks tersebut akan terpotong juga.
mt: One of the most common problems when trying to convert film to DVD format is overscan. Most televisions are made to please the general public. Because of this, everything that is seen on TV has borders on the top, bottom, and sides that are cut off. This is done to ensure that the picture covers the entire screen. This is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, the edges may be cut off, and if there is text that is too low, the text will be cut off as well.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Rencana Amerika mengandalkan peluncuran serangan terkoordinasi dari tiga arah berbeda. Jenderal John Cadwalder dapat melancarkan serangan pengalihan terhadap garnisun Inggris di Bordentown, untuk memblokir bala bantuan. Jenderal James Ewing akan membawa 700 milisi menyeberangi sungai di Trenton Ferry, merebut jembatan di atas Assunpink Creek dan mencegah pasukan musuh melarikan diri. Pasukan penyerang utama sejumlah 2.400 orang akan menyeberangi sungai sembilan mil di utara Trenton, dan kemudian dibagi menjadi dua kelompok, satu di bawah Greene dan satu di bawah Sullivan, untuk melancarkan serangan sebelum fajar.
mt: The American plan relied on a coordinated attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalder could launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, to block reinforcements. General James Ewing would lead 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, capturing the bridge over Assunpink Creek and preventing the enemy from escaping. The main attacking force of some 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then be divided into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, to launch the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Setelah diadopsi oleh Kongres pada 4 Juli, draf tulisan tangan yang ditandatangani oleh Presiden Kongres John Hancock dan Sektretaris Charles Thomson dibawa beberapa blok ke toko percetakan John Dunlap. ""Sepanjang malam sekitar 150 hingga 200 eksemplar dibuat, sekarang dikenal sebagai ""Dunlap broadsides""."" Dokumen itu pertama kali dibacakan secara publik oleh John Nixon di halaman Independence Hall  pada tanggal 8 Juli. Satu dikirim ke George Washington pada 6 Juli, yang membacakannya ke pasukannya di New York pada 9 Juli. Salinan mencapai London pada 10 Agustus. Selebaran 25 Dunlap yang diketahui masih eksis adalah salinan tertua yang masih ada dari dokumen tersebut. Salinan tulisan tangan yang asli sudah tidak ada lagi."
mt: "After being adopted by Congress on July 4, the handwritten draft signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was taken several blocks to the printing shop of John Dunlap. ""Over the night about 150 to 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides""."" The document was first publicly read by John Nixon on the steps of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who read it to his troops in New York on July 9. Copies reached London on August 10. Of the 25 Dunlap broadsides known to exist, the oldest surviving copy is the oldest surviving copy of the document. The original handwritten copy no longer exists."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Melihat kegiatan ini, para Kolonis juga meminta bala bantuan. Pasukan memperkuat posisi terdepan termasuk resimen New Hampshire pertama dan ketiga yang terdiri dari 200 orang, di bawah Kolonel John Stark dan James Reed (keduanya nanti menjadi jenderal). Anak buah Stark mengambil posisi di sepanjang pagar di ujung utara posisi Kolonis. Bila air surut membuka celah di sepanjang Sungai Mystic di timur laut semenanjung, mereka dengan cepat memperpanjang pagar dengan dinding batu pendek ke utara yang berakhir pada tepi air di pantai kecil. Gridley atau Stark bertaruh sekitar 100 kaki ( 30 m) di depan pagar dan memerintahkan tidak ada yang melepaskan tembakan sampai reguler melewatinya.
mt: The Colonists also requested reinforcements. The front line was strengthened, including the first and third regiments of New Hampshire, consisting of 200 men, under Colonel John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence at the northern end of the Colonists' position. If the tide receded to open a gap along the Mystic River to the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north, ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark bet about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered no shots fired until the regulars crossed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Tiongkok kuno punya cara unik untuk menunjukkan periode waktu yang berbeda; setiap tahapan di Tiongkok atau setiap keluarga yang berkuasa adalah dinasti yang berbeda. Selain itu, di selang setiap dinasti terdapat masa tak stabil dari provinsi-provinsi yang terpecah. Yang terpopuler di masa ini adalah epik Tiga Kerajaan yang berlangsung di selang waktu 60 tahun antara dinasti Han dan dinasti Jin. Selama periode ini, peperangan sengit terjadi di antara para bangsawan demi takhta. Tiga Kerajaan adalah salah satu era paling berdarah dalam sejarah Tiongkok Kuno, ribuan orang tewas berjuang untuk duduk di kursi tertinggi di istana agung di Xi'an.
mt: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different periods of time; each stage in China or each ruling family was a different dynasty. In addition, in the span of each dynasty there was an unstable period of provinces that split. The most popular of this time was the epic Three Kingdoms that lasted for 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this period, fierce wars were fought between the nobles for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in the history of Ancient China, thousands died fighting for the highest seat in the palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Pasukan dalam koloni semut berbaris dan juga bersarang dalam berbagai fase. Pada fase nomaden, semut tentara berbaris di malam hari dan berhenti untuk singgah pada siang hari. Koloni memulai fase nomaden apabila makanan yang tersedia berkurang. Selama fase ini, koloni membuat sarang sementara yang diganti setiap hari. Setiap amukan atau gerakan nomaden berlangsung sekitar 17 hari.
mt: Army ants march and also nest in various phases. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop for rest during the day. The colony begins the nomadic phase when food is scarce. During this phase, the colony makes a temporary nest that is replaced every day. Each nomadic march lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Banyak yang memperhatikan ritme di fisiologi dan tingkah laku seringkali bergantung pada kehadiran siklus endogen dan produksinya melalui jam biologis. Irama periodik, yang bukan cuma berupa respons atas isyarat periodik eksternal, telah dicatat untuk sebagian besar makhluk hidup, termasuk jamur, bakteri, hewan, dan tumbuhan. Jam biologis adalah osilator mandiri yang akan melanjutkan periode siklus berjalan bebas bahkan ketika isyarat eksternal tidak ada.
mt: Many have observed that the rhythms of physiology and behavior often depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not merely responses to periodic external stimuli, have been noted in most living organisms, including fungi, bacteria, animals, and plants. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue to run through their cycle free of external stimuli even when external stimuli are absent.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populasi adalah kumpulan organisme dari spesies tertentu dalam area geografis tertentu. Ketika semua individu dalam suatu populasi identik dalam hal sifat fenotipik tertentu, mereka disebut monomorfik. Saat seseorang menunjukkan beberapa jenis dari sifat tertentu, mereka termasuk polimorfik.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same area. When all individuals in a population are identical in terms of certain phenotypic traits, they are called monomorphic. When one shows some types of certain traits, they are included polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Pariwisata berbasis alam memikat orang-orang mendatangi kawasan alam untuk menikmati pemandangan alam, termasuk satwa liar dan tumbuhan. Contoh kegiatan di lokasi termasuk berburu, memancing, fotografi, mengamati burung, dan mengunjungi taman, serta mempelajari informasi tentang ekosistem. Contohnya mengunjungi, memotret, dan belajar tentang orang utan di Kalimantan.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people to visit natural areas to enjoy the scenery, including wildlife and plants. Examples of activities on site include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks, as well as learning about ecosystems. Examples include visiting, photographing, and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Setiap pagi, orang meninggalkan kota kecil dengan mobil untuk pergi ke tempat kerjanya dan berpapasan dengan orang lain yang tujuan kerjanya adalah tempat yang baru mereka tinggalkan. Dalam antar-jemput yang merupakan angkutan dinamis ini setiap orang terhubung dengan, dan mendukung, sebuah sistem transportasi yang didasarkan pada mobil pribadi. Ilmu pengetahuan sekarang mengindikasikan bahwa ekonomi karbon yang masif ini telah melepaskan biosfer dari salah satu keadaan stabilnya yang selama dua juta tahun terakhir telah mendukung evolusi manusia.
mt: Every morning, people leave a small town in their cars to go to work, and meet people who are going to the place they just left. In this dynamic transportation system, each person is connected to, and supports, a massive carbon-based economy. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has released the biosphere from one of its stable states that for the last two million years has supported human evolution.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom dapat dianggap sebagai salah satu unsur penyusun fundamental dari semua materi. Ini merupakan entitas yang sangat kompleks yang terdiri, menurut penyederhanaan model Bohr, atas elektron yang mengorbit pusat nukleus, mirip dengan planet mengorbit matahari -lihat Gambar 1.1. Nukleus terdiri dari dua partikel - neutron dan proton. Proton mempunyai muatan listrik positif, sedangkan neutron tidak mempunyai muatan. Elektron mempunyai muatan listrik negatif.
mt: An atom can be considered one of the fundamental constituents of all matter. It is a very complex entity consisting, according to the simplified Bohr model, of electrons orbiting a nucleus, similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Hampir semua komputer yang digunakan saat ini didasarkan pada manipulasi informasi yang dikodekan dalam bentuk bilangan biner. Angka biner hanya dapat mempunyai satu dari dua nilai, yaitu 0 atau 1, dan angka-angka ini disebut sebagai digit biner - atau bit, sebagai jargon komputer.
mt: Almost all computers in use today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. Binary numbers can only have one of two values, 0 or 1, and these are called binary digits, or bits, as computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Blog juga dapat membantu meningkatkan kemampuan menulis siswa. Sementara itu, siswa biasanya mulai merasakan pengalaman membuat blog dengan tata bahasa dan ejaan yang kurang baik, keberadaan audiens secara umum mengubah itu. Karena pelajar biasanya merupakan audiens paling kritis, penulis blog mulai berupaya meningkatkan kualitas tulisan guna menghindari kritik. ""Selain itu, blog juga ""memaksa siswa untuk lebih melek tentang dunia di sekitar mereka."" Keharusan untuk memuaskan audiens menginspirasi siswa untuk menjadi cerdik dan menarik (Toto, 2004)."" Blog adalah alat yang menginspirasi kolaborasi, dan mendorong pelajar untuk memperluas pembelajaran lebih dari sekolah biasa. ""Penggunaan blog yang tepat ""dapat memberdayakan pelajar untuk lebih analitis dan kritis: dengan cara menanggapi materi internet secara aktif, pelajar bisa mendefinisikan posisi mereka dalam konteks tulisan-tulisan lain dan juga membuat garis besar pendapat mereka terhadap sejumlah isu (Oravec, 2002)."""
mt: "Blogs can also help improve students' writing skills. While students usually start their blogging experience with poor grammar and spelling, the presence of a general audience changes that. Because students are usually the most critical audience, bloggers start to improve their writing to avoid criticism. ""In addition, blogs ""force students to be more aware of the world around them."" The need to satisfy an audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004)."" Blogs are tools that inspire collaboration, and encourage students to expand their learning beyond the classroom. ""The proper use of blogs ""can empower students to be more analytical and critical: by actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their position in the context of other writings and also outline their opinions on a number of issues (Oravec, 2002)."""
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Komunikasi asinkron mendorong kita untuk menyediakan waktu untuk melakukan refleksi dan bereaksi terhadap orang lain. Hal tersebut memungkinkan siswa bekerja sesuai kecepatan mereka dan mengontrol kecepatan informasi yang instruksional. Sebagai tambahan, lebih sedikit batasan waktu dengan jam kerja yang mungkin lebih fleksibel. (Bremer, 1998) Penggunaan internet dan World Wide Web memungkinkan orang yang ingin belajar memperoleh akses informasi sepanjang waktu. Siswa juga dapat menyerahkan pertanyaan kepada instruktur setiap saat sepanjang hari dan mengharapkan tanggapan yang cukup cepat, daripada menunggu hingga pertemuan tatap muka berikutnya.
mt: Asynchronous communication encourages us to provide time for reflection and response to others. This allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, less time constraints with work hours that may be more flexible. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and World Wide Web allows those who want to learn to gain access to information at any time. Students can also submit questions to the instructor at any time throughout the day and expect a quick response, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Kastil abad pertengahan tradisional sudah sejak lama mengilhami imajinasi, memunculkan bayangan perkelahian kelompok berkuda dengan tombak, jamuan makan, dan para ksatria Arthurian. Bahkan saat berdiri di tengah reruntuhan berusia ribuan tahun, mudah untuk membayangkan suara dan aroma pertempuran di masa silam, hingga nyaris dapat mendengar suara tapak kuda menjejak jalan bebatuan dan mencium aroma ketakutan yang berasal dari lubang penjara bawah tanah. Namun, apakah imajinasi kita berdasarkan pada kenyataan? Pertama-tama, untuk apa kastil dibangun? Bagaimana kastil-kastil itu dirancang dan dibangun?
mt: Traditional medieval castles have long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of mounted groups clashing with spears, feasts, and Arthurian knights. Even standing amid the ruins of thousands of years, it is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of past battles, almost able to hear the hoofbeats of horses on the cobblestone streets and smell the fear emanating from the dungeons. But are our imaginations based on reality? First, what were castles built for? How were the castles designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Sesuai ciri khas dari periode tersebut, Kastel Kirby Muxloe lebih seperti rumah berbenteng daripada kastel yang sesungguhnya. Jendela kacanya yang besar dan dindingnya yang tipis tidak akan mampu lebih lama lagi menahan serangan yang ada . Di tahun 1480-an, ketika pembangunannya dimulai oleh Lord Hastings, negara tersebut relatif damai dan pertahanan hanya diperlukan terhadap sekelompok kecil perampok keliling.
mt: As was typical of the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle was more like a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not have lasted much longer against the attacks of the day. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defence was only required against a few roving bandits.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Dengan perubahan dari lari seperempat mil menjadi lari setengah mil, kecepatan menjadi kurang penting dan daya tahan menjadi kebutuhan mutlak. Memang pelari andal setengah mil, yaitu yang mampu mencapai setengah mil dalam dua menit, harus punya kecepatan lumayan tetapi ia harus mengembangkan daya tahan di semua bahaya. Sebagian kecil lari lintas alam di musim dingin, digabungkan dengan latihan gimnasium untuk tubuh bagian atas, adalah persiapan yang paling baik untuk musim lari.
mt: With the change from quarter-mile to half-mile races, speed is less important and endurance is a necessity.  Even the best quarter-mile runners, those who can run a half-mile in two minutes, must have some speed but they must develop endurance in all conditions.  A small part of cross-country running in the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper body, is the best preparation for the season of running.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Praktik nutrisi yang tepat saja tidak dapat menghasilkan performa yang elite, tetapi secara signifikan dapat memengaruhi kesehatan atlet muda secara keseluruhan. Menjaga keseimbangan energi yang sehat, mempraktikkan kebiasaan hidrasi yang efektif, dan memahami berbagai aspek praktik suplementasi dapat membantu atlet meningkatkan kinerja dan kenikmatan olahraga.
mt: Proper nutrition practices alone cannot produce elite performance, but significantly can affect the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve performance and enjoyment of sports.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Lari jarak menengah adalah olahraga yang relatif murah; tetapi, ada banyak kesalahpahaman tentang sedikit peralatan yang diperlukan untuk ikut serta. Produk-produk dapat dibeli sesuai dengan kebutuhannya, tetapi sebagian besar akan sedikit atau sama sekali tidak berdampak pada performa. Para atlet mungkin merasa bahwa mereka menyukai suatu produk bahkan jika produk itu tidak memberikan manfaat yang nyata.
mt: The middle-distance running is a relatively cheap sport; but, there are many misconceptions about little equipment needed to participate. Products can be bought according to its needs, but most will have little or no impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they like a product even if the product does not provide any real benefit.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "MRI berdasarkan kepada sebuah fenomena fisik yang dinamakan resonansi magnetik nuklir (NMR), yang ditemukan pada tahun 1930-an oleh Felix Bloch (bekerja di Universitas Stanford) dan Edward Purcell (dari Universitas Harvard). Dalam resonansi ini, medan magnet, dan gelombang radio menyebabkan atom mengeluarkan sinyal radio kecil. Pada tahun 1970, Raymond Damadian, seorang dokter medis dan ilmuwan penelitian, menemukan dasar untuk menggunakan pencitraan resonansi magnetik sebagai alat diagnosis medis. Empat tahun kemudian sebuah paten diberikan, yang menjadi paten pertama di dunia yang diterbitkan dalam bidang MRI. ""Pada tahun 1977, Dr. Damadian menyelesaikan konstruksi pemindai MRI ""seluruh tubuh"" pertama, yang dinamainya ""Indomitable"". """
mt: "MRI is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, a magnetic field, and radio waves cause atoms to emit small radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, found the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later a patent was granted, which became the first patent in the world issued in the field of MRI. ""In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first ""whole-body"" MRI scanner, which he named ""Indomitable"". ""
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Sejauh ini, manusia adalah spesies yang paling ahli membaca pikiran manusia lainnya. Hal tersebut berarti kita mampu memprediksi dengan baik apa yang manusia lain rasakan, maksudkan, yakini, ketahui atau inginkan. Memahami niat orang lain sangatlah penting di antara kemampuan-kemampuan ini, agar kita dapat menyelesaikan ambiguitas yang mungkin ada dari tindakan fisik. Misalnya, jika Anda melihat seseorang sedang memecahkan kaca jendela mobil, Anda mungkin mengira dia sedang mencoba mencuri mobil orang. Ia perlu dinilai secara berbeda jika ia kehilangan kunci mobilnya dan itu adalah mobilnya sendiri yang ia coba masuki.
mt: So far, humans are the species most adept at reading the minds of other humans. This means we can predict with some accuracy what other humans feel, mean, believe, know, or want. Understanding others' intentions is particularly important among these abilities, so that we can resolve ambiguities that may be present in physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you might think he is trying to steal the car. He needs to be evaluated differently if he has lost his car keys and it is his own car that he is trying to enter.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Walaupun Kecerdasan Buatan memiliki konotasi yang kuat dari fiksi ilmiah, Kecerdasan Buatan membentuk cabang yang sangat penting dari ilmu komputer, berurusan dengan tingkah laku, pembelajaran dan adaptasi kecerdasan dalam mesin. Penelitian dalam Kecerdasan Buatan melibatkan membuat mesin untuk mengotomatiskan pekerjaan yang membutuhkan perilaku cerdas. Contohnya termasuk kontrol, perencanaan dan penjadwalan, kemampuan untuk menjawab diagnosis dan pertanyaan pelanggan, serta pengenalan tulisan tangan, suara dan wajah. Hal-hal seperti ini sudah menjadi disiplin ilmu terpisah, yang berfokus menghadirkan solusi atas masalah-masalah nyata dalam kehidupan. Sistem AI sekarang sering digunakan di bidang ekonomi, kedokteran, teknik dan militer, seperti yang telah dibangun pada beberapa aplikasi komputer rumah dan perangkat lunak gim video.
mt: Although Artificial Intelligence has strong connotations with science fiction, Artificial Intelligence forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with the behaviour, learning and adaptation of intelligence in machines. Research in Artificial Intelligence involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behaviour. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer diagnostic and customer questions, and handwriting, speech and face recognition. Things like this have become separate disciplines, focusing on bringing solutions to real-life problems. AI systems are now often used in fields such as economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as have been built into some home computers and video game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. src: Pola pikir konvergen adalah teknik memecahkan masalah yang menggabungkan beberapa ide atau bidang untuk menemukan sebuah solusi. Fokus dari pola pikir ini adalah kecepatan, logika, dan ketepatan, juga identifikasi fakta, penerapan kembali teknik yang ada, pengumpulan informasi. Faktor terpenting dalam pola pikir ini adalah: hanya ada satu jawaban yang benar. Anda hanya memikirkan dua jawaban, yaitu benar atau salah. Tipe pemikiran macam ini berkaitan dengan sains atau prosedur standar tertentu. Orang dengan tipe pemikiran seperti ini memiliki pemikiran logis, mampu menghafal pola, memecahkan masalah, dan mengerjakan tes ilmiah.
mt: Convergent thinking is a problem-solving technique that combines several ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this pattern of thought is speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as identifying facts, reapplying existing techniques, and gathering information. The most important factor in this pattern of thought is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, either right or wrong. This type of thinking is related to science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, can memorize patterns, solve problems, and take scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Penggunakan perekam video mengarah pada penemuan penting interpretasi ekspresi mikro, gerakan wajah, yang terjadi dalam hitungan milidetik. Secara khusus, dinyatakan bahwa kita dapat mendeteksi apakah seseorang berbohong dengan mengamati ekspresi mikronya dengan benar. Dalam makalahnya yang berjudul The President's Speech, Oliver Sacks menunjukkan bagaimana seseorang yang tak memahami ucapan akibat menderita kerusakan otak tetap mampu secara akurat menilai keikhlasan. Dia bahkan mengusulkan bahwa kemampuan dalam menafsirkan perilaku manusia seperti itu mungkin dimiliki oleh hewan seperti anjing peliharaan.
mt: The use of video recording led to important discoveries in microexpression interpretation, facial microexpressions that occur in milliseconds. Specifically, it was stated that we can detect whether someone is lying by observing their microexpressions accurately. In his paper titled The President's Speech, Oliver Sacks showed how someone who does not understand speech due to brain damage is still able to accurately judge sincerity. He even suggested that such abilities to interpret human behavior may be possessed by animals such as pet dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Dengan perubahan kemampuan memperoleh pengetahuan dan belajar sebagaimana disebutkan di atas, laju dasar pengetahuan diperoleh juga berubah. Pendekatan untuk memperoleh informasinya berbeda. Penekanannya bukan lagi pada ingatan individu, tetapi kemampuan mengingat teks. Pada intinya, Renaisans menciptakan sebuah perubahan yang signifikan dalam pendekatan terhadap pembelajaran dan penyebaran ilmu pengetahuan.
mt: With the change in the ability to acquire knowledge and learning as mentioned above, the basic rate of knowledge acquisition also changes. The approach to obtaining the information is different. The emphasis is no longer on individual memory, but the ability to remember text. In short, the Renaissance created a significant change in the approach to learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Internet mengombinasikan elemen komunikasi massa dan antarpribadi. Karakteristik khusus internet mengarah pada dimensi tambahan dalam hal penggunaan dan pendekatan gratifikasi. ""Contohnya, ""belajar"" dan ""bersosialisasi"" disarankan sebagai motivasi penting dalam penggunaan Internet (James dkk., 1995). "" ""Keterlibatan pribadi"" dan ""hubungan berkelanjutan"" juga diidentifikasi sebagai aspek motivasi baru oleh Eighmey dan McCord (1998) ketika mereka menyelidiki reaksi audiens terhadap situs web. """
mt: "The Internet combines elements of mass and interpersonal communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of use and gratification approaches. For example, "learning" and "socializing" are suggested as important motivations in Internet use (James et al., 1995). " "Personal involvement" and "ongoing relationships" are also identified as new motivational aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to web sites. "
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gaya Gotik memuncak di periode antara abad ke 10-11 dan di abad ke-14. Pada awalnya, pakaian sangat dipengaruhi oleh budaya Bizantium di timur. Namun, akibat saluran komunikasi yang lambat, gaya di barat bisa tertinggal 25 hingga 30 tahun. Jelang akhir Abad Pertengahan, Eropa barat mulai mengembangkan gaya mereka sendiri. salah satu perkembangan terbesar saat itu merupakan akibat dari Perang Salib, orang mulai memakai kancing untuk mengencangkan pakaian.
mt: Gothic fashion peaked in the period between the 10th and 11th centuries and in the 14th century. Initially, clothing was greatly influenced by Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to slow communication channels, styles in the west could be lagging 25 to 30 years. By the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began developing its own styles. One of the biggest developments at the time was a result of the Crusades, people began wearing buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Kita bisa mulai hidup bersahabat dengan lingkungan, kita bisa bergabung dengan gerakan lingkungan, dan kita bahkan bisa menjadi aktivis guna mengurangi dampak yang ditimbulkan di masa depan. Ini seperti pengobatan simtomatik dalam banyak kasus. Namun, jika kita tidak hanya menginginkan solusi sementara, maka kita harus menemukan akar masalahnya, dan kita harus menonaktifkannya. Cukup jelas bahwa dunia berkembang karena ilmu pengetahuan dan teknologi, serta kelebihan jumlah penduduk dan gaya hidup boros manusia menjadi masalah yang cukup besar.
mt: We can start living in harmony with the environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even become activists to reduce the impact in the future. This is like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we are not just looking for temporary solutions, then we need to find the root of the problem, and we need to deactivate it. It is quite clear that the world is developing due to science and technology, as well as the excess population and wasteful lifestyle of humans becoming a big problem.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Keseimbangan kekuatan adalah sistem yaitu negara-negara Eropa berusaha untuk mempertahankan kedaulatan nasional semua negara Eropa. Konsepnya adalah semua negara Eropa harus berusaha mencegah satu negara menjadi terlalu kuat, dan oleh karena itu pemerintah nasional sering mengubah aliansi mereka guna menjaga keseimbangan. Perang Penerus Spanyol menandai perang pertama dengan isu sentral berupa keseimbangan kekuatan. Hal ini menandai perubahan yang penting, karena kekuatan Eropa tidak akan lagi memiliki dalih untuk menjadi perang agama. Dengan demikian, Perang Tiga Puluh Tahun akan menjadi perang terakhir yang ditandai sebagai perang agama.
mt: The Balance of Power is a system in which the European states are trying to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept is that all European states should try to prevent one state from becoming too powerful, and so national governments often change their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession marks the first war with a central issue of the balance of power. This marks a major change, because the power of Europe will no longer have a pretext to be a religious war. Thus, the Thirty Years' War will be the last war marked as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Selama periode bersejarah di Eropa, Gereja Katolik (yang menjadi kaya dan berkuasa) diawasi ketat. Selama lebih dari seribu tahun, agama Kristen telah mempersatukan negara-negara Eropa meski berbeda bahasa dan adat istiadat. Kekuatannya yang menyeluruh memengaruhi semuanya, dari raja hingga rakyat jelata. Salah satu prinsip ajaran Kristen yaitu kekayaan harus digunakan untuk mengatasi penderitaan dan kemiskinan. Dana moneter gereja tersedia untuk tujuan ini. Otoritas pusat gereja telah berada di Roma selama lebih dari seribu tahun, dan pemusatan kekuasaan dan uang ini membuat banyak orang mempertanyakan apakah ajaran ini telah terpenuhi.
mt: During the historical period in Europe, the Catholic Church (which became rich and powerful) was closely watched. For more than a thousand years, the Christian religion had united the countries of Europe despite different languages and customs. Its all-encompassing influence affected everyone, from kings to commoners. One of the Christian teachings is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty. Church monetary funds were available for this purpose. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for more than a thousand years, and the concentration of power and money made many people question whether this teaching had been fulfilled.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Raja Louis XVI yang ketakutan, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua anak kecil mereka (Marie Therese yang berusia 11 tahun dan Louis-Charles yang berusia empat tahun) dan saudara perempuan Raja, Madam Elizabeth, pada tanggal 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa kembali ke Paris dari Versailles oleh massa wanita pasar. Dengan gerbong, mereka melakukan perjalanan kembali ke Paris dengan dikelilingi oleh kerumunan orang yang berteriak dan menyerukan ancaman terhadap Raja dan Ratu. Kerumunan massa memaksa Raja dan Ratu agar membuka lebar-lebat jendela kereta mereka. Pada satu titik, salah seorang anggota gerombolan tersebut mengibarkan kepala milik pengawal kerajaan yang terbunuh di Versailles di hadapan sang Ratu yang ketakutan.
mt: 6 October 1789: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese, age 11, and Louis-Charles, age 4) and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a wagon, they made the journey back to Paris surrounded by a crowd of people shouting and threatening the King and Queen. The crowd forced the King and Queen to open the windows of their carriage. At one point, one of the mob members waved the head of a dead royal guard in front of the terrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Raja Louis XVI yang ketakutan, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua anak kecil mereka (Marie Therese yang berusia 11 tahun dan Louis-Charles yang berusia empat tahun) dan saudara perempuan Raja, Madam Elizabeth, pada tanggal 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa kembali ke Paris dari Versailles oleh massa wanita pasar. Dengan gerbong, mereka melakukan perjalanan kembali ke Paris dengan dikelilingi oleh kerumunan orang yang berteriak dan menyerukan ancaman terhadap Raja dan Ratu. Kerumunan massa memaksa Raja dan Ratu agar membuka lebar-lebat jendela kereta mereka. Pada satu titik, salah seorang anggota gerombolan tersebut mengibarkan kepala milik pengawal kerajaan yang terbunuh di Versailles di hadapan sang Ratu yang ketakutan.
mt: 6 October 1789: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese, age 11, and Louis-Charles, age 4) and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a wagon, they made the journey back to Paris surrounded by a crowd of people shouting and threatening the King and Queen. The crowd forced the King and Queen to open the windows of their carriage. At one point, one of the mob members waved the head of a dead royal guard in front of the terrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Segera setelah permusuhan pecah, Britania memulai blokade laut Jerman. Strategi tersebut terbukti efektif, memutus pasokan penting militer dan sipil, meskipun blokade ini melanggar hukum internasional yang diterima secara umum yang dikodifikasi oleh beberapa perjanjian internasional selama dua abad terakhir. Britania memasang ranjau di perairan internasional untuk mencegah kapal memasuki seluruh bagian samudera, membahayakan kapal-kapal netral sekalipun. Akibat respons yang terbatas atas taktik ini, Jerman menduga adanya respons serupa pada pertempuran kapal selam tak terhingganya.
mt: Immediately after hostilities broke out, Britain began a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although the blockade violated international law accepted in general by several international treaties over the past two centuries. Britain laid mines in international waters to prevent ships from entering the entire ocean, endangering neutral ships as well as. As a result of the limited response to this tactic, Germany assumed a similar response in the unending submarine war.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Di seluruh Amerika Serikat, ada sekitar 400.000 kasus yang terdaftar dari Multiple Sclerosis (MS), yang membuatnya menjadi penyakit neurologis utama di usia dewasa muda dan paruh baya. MS adalah penyakit yang memengaruhi pusat sistem saraf, yang terbentuk dari otak, saraf tulang belakang dan saraf penglihatan. Penelitian menemukan bahwa perempuan dua kali lebih mungkin terkena MS daripada laki-laki.
mt: 400,000 cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) are registered in the United States, making it the leading neurological disease in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves. Research has found that women are twice as likely to be affected by MS than men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Temuan penelitian tersebut ialah depresi, ketakutan, dan asumsi bahwa malapetaka akan terjadi memediasi hubungan antara nyeri dan kecacatan pada penderita nyeri punggung bawah. Hanya efek dari dugaan bencana, bukan depresi dan ketakutan yang merupakan syarat dari sesi PA terstruktur mingguan reguler. Mereka yang ikut serta dalam aktivitas rutin membutuhkan dukungan lebih dalam hal persepsi negatif terhadap nyeri yang membedakan nyeri kronis dan rasa tidak nyaman dari gerakan fisik normal.
mt: The study's findings are depression, fear, and the assumption that disaster will occur mediating the relationship between pain and disability in patients with low back pain. Only the effects of disaster, not depression and fear, are the criteria for a structured weekly PA session. Those who participate in routine activities need more support in terms of negative perceptions of pain that distinguish chronic pain and discomfort from normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Anggar yang merupakan olahraga modern dipertandingkan di berbagai tingkatan, mulai dari pelajar di universitas sampai kompetisi profesional dan Olimpiade. Olahraga ini umumnya dimainkan dalam format duel, satu pemain anggar berduel dengan pemain lain.
mt: Fencing is a modern sport contested at various levels, from school students to professional competitions and the Olympics. The sport is usually played in a duel format, with one fencer dueling another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Keracunan internal mungkin tidak segera terlihat. Gejala-gejala seperti muntah cukup umum, sehingga tidak bisa segera dibuat diagnosisnya. Indikasi terbaik dari keracunan internal mungkin dapat dilihat dari adanya penyimpanan obat yang terbuka atau bahan kimia rumah tangga yang beracun. Periksa label instruksi pertolongan pertama yang spesifik untuk racun tertentu.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Vomiting is common enough that it may not be immediately diagnosed. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of open medication or household chemicals. Check the specific first aid instructions on the label for the specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Untuk memeriksa korban, Anda pertama-tama harus mengamati tempat kejadian guna memastikan keamanan Anda. Anda perlu memperhatikan posisi korban saat Anda mendekatinya, serta memperhatikan tanda bahaya otomatis. Jika Anda terluka saat mencoba menolong, Anda hanya akan membuat situasi menjadi semakin buruk.
mt: To check on the victim, you first need to assess the scene to ensure your safety. You need to observe the victim's position as you approach them, and also observe any automatic warning signs. If you are injured while trying to help, you will only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Ada banyak dampak sosial dan politik seperti penggunaan sistem metrik, pergeseran dari pemerintahan absolut menjadi republik, nasionalisme, dan keyakinan bahwa negara adalah milik rakyat, bukan satu penguasa. Selain itu, setelah revolusi tersebut, lowongan pekerjaan dibuka untuk semua pelamar laki-laki, membuka peluang kesuksesan bagi mereka yang paling ambisius. Hal yang sama berlaku untuk militer karena alih-alih peringkat tentara didasarkan pada kelas, mereka sekarang didasarkan pada cailaber. Revolusi Prancis juga menginspirasi banyak warga kelas pekerja lain yang tertekan dari negara lain untuk memulai revolusi mereka sendiri.
mt: There were many social and political impacts such as the adoption of the metric system, the shift from absolute monarchy to republic, nationalism, and the belief that the country belonged to the people, not one ruler. In addition, after the revolution, job openings were opened to all male applicants, opening up opportunities for success to those who were most ambitious. The same was true for the military, as instead of ranks being based on class, they were now based on ability. The French Revolution also inspired many other oppressed working class citizens from other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Setiap orang ikut serta dalam masyarakat dan menggunakan sistem transportasi. Hampir semua orang mengeluhkan sistem transportasi. Di negara maju, Anda jarang mendengar tingkat keluhan yang sama tentang kualitas air atau jembatan yang runtuh. Mengapa muncul keluhan semacam itu terhadap sistem transportasi, mengapa layanan mereka selalu gagal? Apakah para insinyur transportasi tidak kompeten? Ataukah ada hal yang lebih mendasar yang saat ini terjadi?
mt: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries, you rarely hear the same level of complaints about the quality of water or bridges collapsing. Why do complaints like this arise against transportation systems, why are their services always failing? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental happening right now?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Arus Lalu Lintas ialah studi mengenai pergerakan pengemudi perorangan dan kendaraan antara dua titik dan interaksi yang mereka ciptakan satu sama lain. Sayangnya, mempelajari arus lalu lintas sulit dilakukan sebab perilaku pengemudi tidak dapat diprediksi dengan tingkat kepastian seratus persen. Untungnya, pengemudi cenderung berperilaku dalam rentang yang konsisten secara wajar; oleh karena itu, arus lalu lintas cenderung punya konsistensi yang wajar dan kurang lebih dapat direpresentasikan secara matematis. Untuk merepresentasikan arus lalu lintas dengan lebih baik, telah ditetapkan hubungan antara tiga karakteristik utama: (1) alur, (2) kepadatan, dan (3) kecepatan. Relasi ini membantu dalam hal perencanaan, perancangan, dan pengoperasian fasilitas-fasilitas jalan raya.
mt: Traffic flow is a study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they create with each other. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with a certainty of 100%. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a consistent range of normalcy; therefore, traffic flow tends to have a normal consistency and can be represented mathematically to a reasonable degree. To better represent traffic flow, three main characteristics have been established: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in the planning, design, and operation of road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Percobaan Hershey dan Chase merupakan salah satu usulan utama yang menyatakan bahwa DNA adalah materi genetik. Hershey dan Chase menggunakan fag, atau virus, untuk menanamkan DNA mereka sendiri ke dalam bakteri. Mereka telah melakukan dua eksperimen, yaitu menandai DNA di dalam fag dengan fosfor radioaktif dan menandai protein fag dengan sulfur radioaktif.
mt: Hershey and Chase's experiment was one of the main proposals that DNA is the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phage, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into bacteria. They had done two experiments, tagging DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus and tagging phage protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Efek mutasi dapat bervariasi, tergantung pada jenis mutasinya, signifikansi potongan materi genetik yang terdampak, dan apakah sel yang terdampak merupakan sel silsilah kuman. Hanya mutasi di sel germline bisa diteruskan ke anak, sementara mutasi lainnya dapat mengakibatkan kematian sel atau kanker.
mt: The effects of a mutation can vary, depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cell is a germ cell. Only mutations in germ cells can be passed on to children, while other mutations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Kambing tampaknya mulai dijinakkan sekitar 10.000 tahun lalu di pegunungan Zagros di Iran. Budaya dan suku kuno mulai memelihara kambing agar mudah mendapatkan susu, bulu, daging, dan kulitnya. Kambing piaraan biasanya mengawasi kawanan yang berkeliaran ke perbukitan atau area penggembalaan lainnya. Kambing cenderung sering digunakan oleh anak-anak atau orang dewasa, serupa dengan yang lebih dikenal oleh gembala. Metode penggembalaan ini masih digunakan hingga hari ini.
mt: Goats appear to have been domesticated around 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to tame goats to easily obtain milk, wool, meat, and skin. Tame goats usually watch over herds that graze on hills or other grazing areas. Goats are often used by children or adults, similar to what is more familiar by shepherds. This method of grazing is still used to this day.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf adalah permainan yaitu pemain menggunakan pemukul untuk memasukkan bola ke lubang. Delapan belas lubang dimainkan selama ronde reguler, para pemain biasanya memulai di lubang pertama di lapangan dan selesai di lubang ke-18. Pemenangnya adalah pemain yang melakukan pukulan atau ayunan stik paling sedikit untuk menyelesaikan permainan. Permainan ini dimainkan di atas rumput, dan rumput di sekitar lubang dipotong lebih pendek dan dinamakan hijau.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use a club to hit a ball into a hole. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, players usually start at the first hole on the course and finish at the eighteenth. The winner is the player who makes the fewest strokes to complete the game. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the holes is cut shorter and is called green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Sasaran utama sains ialah mengetahui cara dunia bekerja melalui metode ilmiah. Metode ini sebenarnya memandu sebagian besar penelitian ilmiah. Ini tidak sendirian, eksperimentasi, dan sebuah eksperimen adalah tes yang digunakan untuk menghilangkan satu atau lebih dari kemungkinan hipotesis, mengajukan pertanyaan, dan membuat pengamatan juga memandu penelitian ilmiah.
mt: The goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. This method actually guides much of scientific research. It is not alone, experimentation, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, posing questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Bila dibandingkan dengan badai-badai ganas lainnya, tornado hanya menyerang area kecil, tetapi dapat menghancurkan semua yang dilewatinya. Tornado dapat mencabut pohon, merobek papan dari bangunan, dan melemparkan mobil ke langit. Dua persen tornado yang paling ganas dapat berlangsung selama lebih dari tiga jam. Badai berkekuatan besar ini memiliki kecepatan angin hingga 480 km/jam (133 m/dtk; 300 mil per jam).
mt: Compared to other violent storms, tornadoes only affect small areas, but can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes can uproot trees, rip siding from buildings, and toss cars into the air. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes can last more than three hours. This powerful storm can have wind speeds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Manusia telah membuat dan menggunakan lensa pembesar sejak ribuan tahun lalu. Namun, teleskop asli pertama dibuat di Eropa pada akhir abad ke-16. Teleskop ini menggunakan kombinasi dua lensa agar objek yang jauh tampak lebih dekat dan lebih besar.
mt: Humans have made and used magnifying lenses for thousands of years. However, the first true telescope was made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. This telescope used a combination of two lenses so that distant objects appeared closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: """Muhammad sangat tertarik dengan hal-hal di luar kehidupan duniawi ini. Ia sering mengunjungi gua yang kemudian dikenal sebagai ""Hira '"" di Gunung ""Nur"" (cahaya) untuk bertafakur."" ia mengurung diri, yang bertahan melintasi waktu, memberikan gambaran yang sangat hidup tentang kecenderungan spritual Muhammad. Berada di puncak salah satu gunung di utara Kota Mekah, gua tersebut benar-benar terisolasi dari seluruh dunia. Faktanya, tempat ini tidak mudah untuk ditemukan bahkan ketika seseorang tahu bahwa tempat ini ada. Setelah berada di dalam gua, kondisinya adalah isolasi total. Tak ada yang bisa dilihat selain langit indah dan bersih di atas serta pegunungan di sekelilingnya. Hanya sedikit sekali yang dapat dilihat atau didengar dari dalam gua ini."
mt: """Muhammad was very interested in things beyond the life of this world. He often visited the cave known as "Hira" on Mount "Nur" (light) to meditate."" he secluded himself, which lasted over time, giving a very vivid picture of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. Located on top of one of the mountains north of the city of Mecca, the cave was truly isolated from the whole world. In fact, this place is not easy to find even when someone knows that this place exists. After being in the cave, the condition is total isolation. Nothing can be seen except the beautiful and clean sky above and mountains around it. Only a little can be seen or heard from this cave.""
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Wagonways dibangun di Inggris pada awal abad ke-16. Walau jalur-jalur kereta hanya terdiri dari papan kayu secara paralel, dengan jalur ini kuda dapat menarik kereta sehingga lebih kencang dan menarik beban lebih banyak dibanding jalanan yang sedikit lebih kasar pada saat yang sama. Bantalan rel diperkenalkan sejak awal untuk menahan trek pada tempatnya. Namun, perlahan disadari bahwa trek tersebut akan lebih efisien apabila memiliki lapisan besi pada bagian atasnya. Ini menjadi praktik yang umum, tetapi besi menyebabkan roda kayu pada kereta lebih cepat rusak. Pada akhirnya, roda kayu digantikan oleh roda besi. Di tahun 1767, lahirlah rel pertama yang sepenuhnya terbuat dari besi.
mt: Wagonways were built in England in the early 16th century. Although the tracks were only made of parallel wooden planks, with these tracks horses could pull wagons faster and haul more weight than on slightly rougher roads at the same time. Wooden sleepers were introduced early on to keep the track in place. However, it was gradually realized that the track would be more efficient if it had an iron layer on top of it. This became common practice, but iron caused wooden wheels on the wagons to wear out faster. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first fully iron track was born.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
