src: Greenland berpenduduk jarang. Di saga Nordik dikatakan bahwa Erik si Merah diasingkan dari Islandia akibat pembunuhan, dan saat pergi ke barat menemukan Greenland dan menamakannya Greenland. Namun, terlepas dari penemuannya, suku Eskimo telah tinggal di sana pada saat itu. Meskipun setiap negara adalah 'Skandinavia', ada banyak perbedaan antara orang, raja, adat istiadat dan sejarah Denmark, Swedia, Norwegia, dan Islandia.
mt: Greenland is sparsely populated. In the saga of the Norse, it is said that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland due to murder, and when he went west he found Greenland and named it Greenland. However, regardless of his discovery, the Inuit had lived there at the time. Although each country is 'Scandinavian', there are many differences between the people, kings, customs and histories of Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. src: Meskipun sebagian besar makanan mereka tidak asing bagi kita, orang Romawi memang memiliki andil dalam makanan pesta yang aneh atau tidak biasa, termasuk babi hutan, merak, siput, dan sejenis hewan pengerat yang disebut tikus. Perbedaan lainnya yaitu saat orang miskin dan perempuan itu menyantap makanan sambil duduk di kursi, orang kaya suka menikmati jamuan makan bersama sambil bersantai dan menyantap makanannya. Makanan Romawi kuno tidak dapat membawa makanan yang datang ke Eropa dari Amerika atau dari Asia di abad-abad berikutnya. Misalnya, mereka tidak memiliki jagung, tomat, kentang, atau cokelat, dan tidak ada orang Romawi kuno yang pernah mencicipi kalkun.
mt: Although most of their food was not strange to us, the Romans did have a hand in the weird or unusual food served at parties, including wild boar, peacocks, snails, and a type of rodent called mice. Other differences were that when the poor and women ate, they sat on chairs, the rich liked to enjoy their meals while sitting and relaxing. Roman food could not bring food that came to Europe from America or Asia in the following centuries. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, or chocolate, and no Roman ever tasted turkey.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Peradaban adalah sebuah kebudayaan tunggal yang dijalankan bersama oleh sekelompok orang yang hidup dan bekerja bersama, sebagai masyarakat. Kata peradaban berasal dari Bahasa Latin civilis, yang berarti sipil, berkaitan dengan Bahasa Latin civis, yang artinya warga negara, dan civitas, artinya kota atau kota-negara, dan hal tersebut juga menjadi tolok ukur besarnya suatu masyarakat. Negara-negara kota merupakan pelopor bangsa. Budaya peradaban mengartikan penerusan pengetahuan di beberapa generasi, jejak budaya yang masih tersisa, dan penyebaran yang wajar. Kebudayaan minoritas biasanya lenyap tanpa meninggalkan bukti sejarah yang relevan dan gagal diakui sebagai peradaban yang layak.
mt: A civilization is a single culture practiced by a group of people living and working together, as a society. The word civilization is derived from Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and this is also the measure of the size of a society. City-states were the pioneers of nations. Civilizational culture means the continuation of knowledge through generations, the traces of culture that remain, and the spread of the reasonable. Minority cultures usually disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and fail to be recognized as a civilization worthy of recognition.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong merupakan reruntuhan benteng dan biara Buddha di bagian atas Distrik Paro (di Desa Phondey). Dikatakan bahwa pada tahun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel membangun benteng untuk memperingati kemenangannya melawan pasukan Tibet-Mongolia. Di tahun 1951, kebakaran yang terjadi membuat peninggalan Drukgyal Dzong hanya tersisa beberapa saja, contohnya gambar Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Seusai kebakaran, benteng ini dilestarikan dan dilindungi dan masih menjadi salah satu objek wisata paling sensasional di Bhutan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is the ruins of a fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro district (in Phondey village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal built the fortress to commemorate his victory over the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. In 1951, a fire destroyed the Drukgyal Dzong leaving only a few remnants, such as a picture of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected and still remains one of the most spectacular tourist attractions in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Selama Abad ke-18 Kamboja terjepit di antara dua tetangga yang kuat, yaitu Thailand dan Vietnam. Orang Thailand menginvasi Kamboja beberapa kali pada abad ke-18 dan pada tahun 1772 mereka menghancurkan Phnom Phen. Di pengujung abad ke-18, orang Vietnam juga menginvasi Kamboja.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was caught between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. At the end of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Awal mula Taiwan dimulai jauh sejak abad ke-15 yaitu para pelaut Eropa yang lewat mencatat nama pulau itu sebagai Ilha Formosa, atau pulau yang indah. Pada tahun 1624, Perusahaan Hindia Timur Belanda membangun basis di Taiwan selatan, dan memprakarsai transformasi dalam praktik produksi biji-bijian lokal dan mempekerjakan para buruh Tionghoa untuk bekerja di sawah dan perkebunan tebunya. Pada tahun 1683, pasukan Dinasti Qing (1644-1912) mengambil alih area pesisir barat dan utara Taiwan dan menyatakan Taiwan sebagai provinsi milik Kekaisaran Qing pada tahun 1885. Pada tahun 1895, setelah kekalahan di Perang Tiongkok-Jepang Pertama (1894-1895), pemerintahan Qing menandatangani Perjanjian Shimonoseki, yang menyerahkan kedaulatannya atas Taiwan kepada Jepang, yang memerintah pulau tersebut hingga 1945.
mt: Taiwan's history began in the 15th century when European sailors passing through noted the island's name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company built a base in southern Taiwan, and initiated a transformation in local grain production practices and employed Chinese laborers to work in its rice paddies and tea plantations. In 1683, Qing Dynasty (1644-1912) forces took over Taiwan's west and north coasts and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded its sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Ini disebut pH kimiawi. Anda bisa membuat indikator dengan memakai jus kubis merah. Jus kubis berubah warna tergantung asam atau basa (alkalin) bahan kimianya. Tingkat pH ditunjukkan oleh jumlah ion Hidrogen (H dalam pH) dalam bahan kimia yang diuji. Ion hidrogen adalah proton yang elektronnya dilucuti (sebab atom Hidrogen memiliki satu proton dan satu elektron).
mt: This is called chemical pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. Red cabbage juice changes color depending on the acidity or alkalinity of the chemical it is testing. The pH level is indicated by the number of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that have had their electrons stripped off (because hydrogen atoms have one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Singa adalah kucing paling sosial, hidup dalam kelompok besar yang disebut prides. Prides terdiri dari satu hingga tiga jantan dewasa bersaudara, bersama dengan 30 betina dan anak-anaknya. Betina biasanya terjalin erat satu sama lain, sebagai keluarga besar saudari dan anak perempuan. Prides singa berlaku seperti kawanan serigala atau anjing, hewan yang secara mengejutkan mirip dengan singa (tetapi bukan kucing besar lainnya) dalam perilakunya, dan juga sangat mematikan bagi mangsanya.
mt: Lions are the most social of cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides consist of one to three adult brothers, along with 30 females and their offspring. Females are usually closely bonded to one another, like a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides behave like packs of wolves or dogs, animals that surprisingly resemble lions (but not other large cats) in their behavior, and are also deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Kucing ukuran sedang yang berada di bawahnya memangsa hewan berukuran sedang, contohnya kelinci, antelop dan rusa. Yang terakhir, ada banyak kucing kecil (termasuk kucing peliharaan yang lepas) yang memakan jauh lebih banyak mangsa kecil seperti serangga, binatang pengerat, kadal, dan burung. Rahasia kesuksesan mereka adalah konsep ceruk, pekerjaan khusus yang diemban oleh setiap kucing untuk menjaga mereka agar tidak berkompetisi dengan kucing-kucing lainnya.
mt: Medium-sized cats that live below them eat medium-sized prey, such as rabbits, antelopes and deer. Last, there are many small cats (including escaped house cats) that eat much more small prey such as insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. Their secret to success is the niche concept, a specialized job that each cat takes to keep them from competing with other cats.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ocelot suka makan binatang kecil. Ocelot akan menangkap monyet, ular, hewan pengerat dan burung jika bisa. Hampir semua hewan yang diburu ocelot berukuran jauh lebih kecil. Ilmuwan beranggapan bahwa ocelot mengikuti dan mencari hewan untuk dimakan (dimangsa) lewat penciuman, mengendus jejak mangsa di tanah. Mereka dapat melihat dengan jelas di dalam kegelapan dengan kemampuan penglihatan malam, dan juga bergerak dengan sangat senyap. Ocelot berburu mangsanya dengan cara membaur dengan lingkungan sekitar, lalu menyergap mangsanya.
mt: Ocelots like to eat small animals. Ocelots will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all the animals that ocelots hunt are much smaller. Scientists believe that ocelots follow and search for animals to eat (prey) by sniffing out the tracks of prey on the ground. They can see clearly in the dark with night vision, and also move very quietly. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings, then ambushing their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Sebagai atlet yang serbabisa, harimau bisa memanjat (walaupun tidak terlalu ahli), berenang, melompat dengan jarak jauh, dan menarik 5 kali lebih kuat daripada manusia. Harimau masih satu grup (Genus Panthera) dengan singa, macan tutul, dan jaguar. Keempat kucing ini adalah jenis yang bisa mengaum. Bunyi auman harimau tidak seperti auman singa yang suaranya penuh, tetapi lebih menyerupai kalimat yang kata-katanya diucapkan dengan bunyi geraman, teriakan.
mt: As a versatile athlete, lions can climb (although not very well), swim, jump long distances, and pull five times stronger than humans. Lions are still one group (Genus Panthera) with tigers, leopards, and jaguars. All four cats are types that can roar. The lion's roar is not like the roar of a lion, which is full of sound, but more like a sentence whose words are spoken with a grunt, a scream.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Sebagai atlet yang serbabisa, harimau bisa memanjat (walaupun tidak terlalu ahli), berenang, melompat dengan jarak jauh, dan menarik 5 kali lebih kuat daripada manusia. Harimau masih satu grup (Genus Panthera) dengan singa, macan tutul, dan jaguar. Keempat kucing ini adalah jenis yang bisa mengaum. Bunyi auman harimau tidak seperti auman singa yang suaranya penuh, tetapi lebih menyerupai kalimat yang kata-katanya diucapkan dengan bunyi geraman, teriakan.
mt: As a versatile athlete, lions can climb (although not very well), swim, jump long distances, and pull five times stronger than humans. Lions are still one group (Genus Panthera) with tigers, leopards, and jaguars. All four cats are types that can roar. The lion's roar is not like the roar of a lion, which is full of sound, but more like a sentence whose words are spoken with a grunt, a scream.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Sel adalah unit fungsional dan struktural terkecil dari makhluk (organisme) hidup. Sel berasal dari cella, yang dalam bahasa latin berarti ruangan kecil. Jika Anda melihat benda-benda dengan mikroskop, Anda akan melihat bahwa mereka terdiri dari kumpulan persegi atau bola-bola kecil. Robert Hooke, seorang biologis dari Inggris, melihat kotak kecil di dalam gabus dengan sebuah mikroskop. Hal itu tampak seperti kamar. Ia adalah orang pertama yang mengamati sel mati
mt: Cells are the structural and functional units of living organisms. The word cell comes from cella, which in Latin means small room. If you look at things with a microscope, you will see that they are made up of a collection of squares or balls. Robert Hooke, an English biologist, saw little boxes in a piece of cork with a microscope. It looked like a room. He was the first person to observe dead cells
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Hewan tersusun dari banyak sel. Hewan memakan dan mencernanya. Sebagian besar hewan bisa bergerak. Hanya binatang memiliki otak (tetapi tidak semua binatang memilikinya; ubur-ubur, sebagai contoh, tidak memiliki otak). Hewan bisa ditemukan di berbagai tempat di Bumi. Hewan menggali tanah, berenang di laut, dan terbang di angkasa.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. Animals eat and digest them. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (but not all animals have them; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals can be found in many places on Earth. Animals dig in the ground, swim in the sea, and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Tumbuhan menghasilkan oksigen yang dihirup manusia, dan mereka menghirup karbondioksida yang dikeluarkan manusia (yang artinya, bernapas). Tumbuhan membuat makanan mereka dari matahari melalui fotosintesis. Mereka juga memberikan tempat berteduh. Kita membuat rumah dari tanaman dan membuat pakaian dari tanaman. Kebanyakan makanan yang kita makan ialah tumbuhan. Tanpa tumbuhan, hewan tidak bisa bertahan hidup.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that humans breathe, and they breathe in carbon dioxide that humans exhale (which means, they breathe). Plants make their food from the sun through photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most of the food we eat is plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Ketika sekelompok kecil makhluk hidup (populasi kecil) terpisah dari populasi utama asalnya (seperti jika mereka pindah ke pegunungan atau sungai, atau jika mereka pindah ke pulau baru sehingga mereka tidak dapat dengan mudah kembali), mereka akan sering menjumpai lingkungan yang berbeda dari yang mereka tempati sebelumnya. Lingkungan baru ini memiliki sumber daya dan kompetitor yang berbeda, jadi populasi yang baru membutuhkan fitur atau adaptasi yang berbeda untuk dapat menjadi kompetitor yang lebih kuat daripada yang mereka butuhkan sebelumnya. Populasi aslinya belum berubah sama sekali, mereka masih membutuhkan adaptasi yang sama seperti sebelumnya. Seiring waktu, ketika populasi baru mulai beradaptasi dengan lingkungan barunya, mereka tampaknya semakin berkurang seperti populasi lain. Pada akhirnya, setelah ribuan atau bahkan jutaan tahun, kedua populasi akan tampak sangat berbeda hingga mereka tidak bisa disebut spesies yang sama. Kami menyebutnya proses spesiasi, yang berarti pembentukan spesies baru. Spesiasi adalah konsekuensi yang tidak dapat dihindari dan bagian yang sangat penting dari evolusi.
mt: When a small group of living things (a small population) is separated from its original main population (such as if they move to mountains or rivers, or if they move to a new island so they cannot easily return), they will often encounter a different environment from the one they occupied before. The new environment has different resources and competitors, so the new population needs features or adaptations that are different from what they needed before. The original population has not changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to its new environment, they seem to be decreasing more and more like other populations. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look very different until they cannot be called the same species. We call this the process of speciation, which means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Organ utama dari sistem peredaran darah adalah jantung, yang memompa darah. Darah mengalir dari jantung dalam saluran-saluran bernama arteri dan kembali ke jantung melalui saluran-saluran bernama vena. Saluran yang terkecil disebut kapiler.
mt: The main organs of the circulatory system are the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows from the heart through arteries and back to the heart through veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Organ utama dari sistem peredaran darah adalah jantung, yang memompa darah. Darah mengalir dari jantung dalam saluran-saluran bernama arteri dan kembali ke jantung melalui saluran-saluran bernama vena. Saluran yang terkecil disebut kapiler.
mt: The main organs of the circulatory system are the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows from the heart through arteries and back to the heart through veins. The smallest vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Serangga adalah hewan pertama yang menjelajah angkasa. Kemampuan terbangnya membantu mereka menghindari musuh dengan lebih mudah dan mencari makanan dan pasangan dengan lebih efisien. Sebagian besar serangga punya keuntungan mampu melipat sayapnya sejajar tubuh. Ini memberi mereka pilihan lebih luas untuk tempat berukuran kecil untuk bersembunyi dari pemangsa. Saat ini, satu-satunya serangga yang tidak dapat melipat sayapnya adalah capung dan lalat capung.
mt: Insects are the first animals to fly in space. Their ability to fly helps them avoid predators more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings parallel to their body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Currently, the only insect that cannot fold its wings is the dragonfly and the damselfly.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Banyak ahli paleontologi sekarang percaya bahwa 1 grup dinosaurus selamat dan masih hidup hari ini. Kita menyebut mereka sebagai burung. Banyak orang tidak berpikir bahwa mereka adalah dinosaurus karena mereka memiliki bulu dan bisa terbang. Namun, ada banyak hal tentang burung yang masih terlihat seperti dinosaurus. Mereka memiliki kaki dengan sisik dan cakar, bertelur, dan berjalan dengan dua kaki belakang seperti T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists now believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is still alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. However, there are many things about birds that still look like dinosaurs. They have legs with scales and claws, lay eggs, and walk on two hind legs like T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Triceratops memiliki gigi yang tidak hanya bisa melumat daun, tetapi juga cabang atau akar yang sangat alot. Beberapa ilmuwan mengira Triceratop memakan palem sagu, yang merupakan jenis tumbuhan yang umum di zaman Kapur. Tanaman-tanaman ini terlihat seperti palem kecil bermahkota daun yang runcing dan tajam. Seekor Triceratops dapat menggunakan paruhnya yang kuat untuk memangkas daun sebelum memakan batangnya. Ilmuwan lainnya mengatakan bahwa tanaman-tanaman ini sangat beracun sehingga sepertinya tidak ada dinosaurus yang memakannya, walaupun sekarang beruang sloth dan hewan lain seperti nuri (keturunan dari dinosaurus) bisa memakan daun atau buah beracun.
mt: Triceratops had teeth that could not only crush leaves, but also branches or roots that were very tough. Some scientists think Triceratops ate sago palms, which were common in the Cretaceous. These plants looked like small palm trees with pointed and sharp leaf crowns. A Triceratops could use its strong beak to trim leaves before eating the stems. Other scientists say that these plants were very poisonous so that no dinosaurs ate them, although now sloth bears and other animals like nutrias (descendants of dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Sepak bola nasional Italia, juga tim sepak bola nasional Jerman merupakan tim tersukses di peringkat kedua dunia dan merupakan juara Piala Dunia FIFA pada 2006. Olahraga populer antara lain: sepak bola, basket, voli, polo air, anggar, rugbi, balap sepeda, hoki es, hoki, dan balapan motor F1. Olahraga musim dingin paling populer di kawasan Utara, dengan orang Italia yang berkompetisi dalam pertandingan internasional dan acara Olimpiade.
mt: Italy's national football team, also the German national football team, is the second most successful team in the world and is the FIFA World Cup champion in 2006. Popular sports include: football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, and Formula 1 motor racing. The most popular winter sports are in the northern region, with Italians competing in international competitions and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luksemburg memiliki sejarah panjang, tetapi sudah merdeka sejak tahun 1839. Yang saat ini merupakan bagian dari Belgia, dahulunya bagian dari Luksemburg tetapi menjadi bagian dari Belgia setelah Revolusi Belgia di tahun 1830-an. Luksemburg selalu berusaha tetap netral, tetapi negara ini diduduki oleh Jerman saat Perang Dunia I dan Perang Dunia II. Di tahun 1957, Luksemburg menjadi salah satu pendiri organisasi yang di kemudian hari dikenal dengan sebutan Uni Eropa.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but has been independent since 1839. What is now part of Belgium, was formerly part of Luxembourg, but became part of Belgium after the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but the country was occupied by Germany during World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg was one of the founding members of the organization that later became known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but has been independent since 1839. What is now part of Belgium, was formerly part of Luxembourg, but became part of Belgium after the Belgian Revolution in the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but the country was occupied by Germany during World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg was one of the founding members of the organization that later became known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Turki Eropa (Trakia timur atau Rumelia di Semenanjung Balkan) mencakup 3% dari negara tersebut. Wilayah Turki memiliki panjang lebih dari 1.600 kilometer (1.000 mil) dan lebar 800 km (500 mil), dengan bentuk kira-kira persegi panjang. Wilayah Turki, termasuk danau, mencakup 783.562 kilometer persegi (300.948 mil persegi), bagian yang seluas 755.688 kilometer persegi (291.773 mil persegi) berada di barat daya Asia dan 23.764 kilometer persegi (9.174 mil persegi) di Eropa. Wilayah Turki membuatnya menjadi negara terbesar ke 37, dan ukurannya seperti Kota Metropolitan Prancis dan Inggris Raya digabungkan. Turki dikelilingi oleh laut di tiga sisi: Laut Aegea di barat, Laut Hitam di utara dan Laut Mediterania di selatan.
mt: 3% of Turkey is in Europe (Thrace in the east or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). The region of Turkey has a length of more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 miles) and a width of 800 km (500 miles), with a shape roughly rectangular. The region of Turkey, including lakes, covers 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 square miles) is in southwest Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 square miles) in Europe. The region of Turkey makes it the 37th largest country, and its size is like the combined City of Paris and London. Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides: the Aegean Sea in the west, the Black Sea in the north and the Mediterranean Sea in the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Populasi Kota Vatikan sekitar 800. Ini adalah negara merdeka terkecil di dunia dan negara dengan populasi terendah. Kota Vatikan menggunakan bahasa Italia dalam legislasi dan komunikasi resminya. Bahasa Italia juga merupakan bahasa sehari-hari yang digunakan oleh sebagian besar orang yang bekerja di negara tersebut, sedangkan Bahasa Latin sering digunakan dalam upacara keagamaan. Semua warga Kota Vatikan beragama Katolik Roma.
mt: Vatican City has a population of around 800. It is the smallest country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the language used by most people who work in the country, while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Saat ini, komputer digunakan untuk memanipulasi gambar dan video. Animasi canggih dapat dirancang di komputer. Jenis animasi ini makin banyak dipakai di televisi dan film. Musik sering direkam menggunakan komputer canggih guna memproses dan mencampur suara.
mt: Computers are used to manipulate images and video. Complex animations can be designed on computers. This type of animation is increasingly used in television and film. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Kota Harappa dan Mohenjo-daro memiliki toilet siram di hampir setiap rumah, yang terhubung dengan sistem pembuangan limbah yang canggih. Peninggalan sistem pembuangan ditemukan di banyak rumah di kota-kota Minoan di Kreta dan Santorini di Yunani. Ada juga toilet di Mesir, Persia, dan Tiongkok kuno. Dalam peradaban Romawi, toilet terkadang menyatu dengan rumah pemandian umum, tempat laki-laki dan perempuan menggunakannya bersama-sama.
mt: Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had flush toilets in almost every house, connected to sophisticated sewage systems. Remains of sewage systems have been found in many houses in Minoan cities in Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia, and China. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bathhouses, where men and women used them together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Bilah pada seluncur es modern memiliki sisi ganda dengan cekungan kosong diantaranya. Dua sisi ini memungkinkan cengkeraman yang lebih baik terhadap es, bahkan ketika dimiringkan. Karena sisi bahwa mata pisaunya agak bengkok, ketika mata tersebut miring ke satu sisi atau sisi lainnya, maka tepi yang bersinggungan dengan es juga membengkok. Hal ini menyebabkan skater berbelok. Jika papan skater miring ke kanan, skater berbelok ke kanan, jika papan skater miring ke kiri, skater belok kiri.
mt: The blades of modern ice skates have double edges with hollows between them. These edges allow for better grip on the ice, even when tilted. Because the edges of the blades are slightly bent, when the blades are tilted to one side or the other, the edges that touch the ice also bend. This causes the skater to turn. If the skater tilts the blades to the right, the skater turns to the right, if the skater tilts the blades to the left, the skater turns left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Untuk kembali ke tingkat energi sebelumnya, atom-atom tersebut harus membuang energi berlebih yang mereka dapatkan dari cahaya. ""Mereka melakukan hal ini dengan cara memancarkan sebuah partikel kecil cahaya kecil yang biasa disebut ""foton""."" ""Ilmuwan menyebut proses ini ""menstimulasi emisi radiasi"" sebab atom-atom terstimulasi cahaya terang, yang menyebabkan emisi foton cahaya, dan cahaya merupakan salah satu tipe radiasi."" Gambar selanjutnya memperlihatkan atom yang memancarkan foton. Tentu saja, di dunia nyata foton jauh lebih kecil daripada yang ada di gambar. Foton bahkan ukurannya lebih kecil dari hal-hal penyusun atom"
mt: "To return to the previous energy level, those atoms must get rid of the excess energy they get from light. ""They do this by emitting a small particle of light called a ""photon."" ""Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by light, which causes the emission of light photons, and light is one type of radiation."" The next image shows an atom emitting a photon. Of course, in the real world, photons are much smaller than what is shown in the image. A photon is even smaller than the things that make up atoms.
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Setelah beroperasi selama ratusan jam, filamen bohlam akhirnya terbakar dan bohlam tidak lagi bercahaya. Bola lampu perlu diganti. Mohon berhati-hati saat mengganti bola lampu. Pertama, sakelar untuk perlengkapan lampu harus dimatikan atau kabelnya dicabut. Hal ini disebabkan oleh aliran listrik yang mengalir ke soket tempat bagian logam bohlam berada, yang bisa menyebabkan sengatan listrik yang fatal apabila Anda menyentuh bagian dalam soket atau dasar logam bohlam saat sebagian di antaranya masih menancap di soket.
mt: After operating for hundreds of hours, the filament finally burned out and the bulb no longer shines. The light bulb needs to be replaced. Please be careful when replacing the light bulb. First, the light fixture power switch must be turned off or the power cord unplugged. This is because the electricity flowing to the socket where the metal bulb base is located, can cause fatal electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the bottom of the metal bulb base while some of it is still inserted into the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bom fisi bekerja berdasarkan prinsip bahwa energi diperlukan untuk membentuk sebuah inti atom dengan banyak proton dan neutron. Seperti mendorong gerobak berat ke atas bukit. Membelah nukleus lagi kemudian melepaskan sebagian energi itu. Beberapa atom memiliki inti yang tidak stabil yang berarti atom cenderung pecah dengan sedikit atau tanpa sentuhan.
mt: Fission works on the principle that energy is required to form an atomic nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Like pushing a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus again then releasing some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable cores meaning the atom tends to break with little or no touching.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Saat Anda menelepon seseorang yang jaraknya ribuan mil, maka Anda menggunakan satelit. Satelit di luar angkasa menerima panggilan kemudian memantulkannya kembali, nyaris seketika. Satelit itu dikirim ke luar angkasa oleh roket. Ilmuwan menggunakan teleskop di luar angkasa, karena atmosfer bumi mengubah sebagian cahaya dan pandangan kita. Diperlukan roket raksasa yang tingginya lebih dari 100 kaki untuk meletakkan satelit atau teleskop di luar angkasa.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. A satellite in space receives the call and then relays it back almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space, because the Earth's atmosphere changes some of the light and our view. It takes a giant rocket, taller than 100 feet, to place a satellite or telescope in space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Waktu ialah sesuatu yang ada di sekitar kita, dan memengaruhi segala hal yang kita lakukan, walau demikian sulit untuk dipahami. Waktu telah dipelajari oleh para sarjana agama, filosofis, dan ilmiah selama ribuan tahun. Kami melewati waktu seperti rangkaian peristiwa yang berlalu dari masa depan hingga masa kini lalu ke masa lalu. Waktu juga merupakan cara kita membandingkan durasi (panjang) kejadian. Anda sendiri bisa menandai sendiri berlalunya waktu, caranya amati kejadian-kejadian yang berulang. Kejadian yang berulang ialah sesuatu yang terjadi lagi dan lagi secara teratur.
mt: Time is something that is around us, and affects everything we do, yet it is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We pass time as a series of events that pass from the future to the present and then to the past. Time is also a way of comparing the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing recurring events. Recurring events are things that happen again and again in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Secara tradisional, pewaris takhta akan langsung masuk militer setelah menyelesaikan sekolah. Namun, Charles berkuliah di Trinity College, Cambridge di sana dia belajar Antropologi dan Arkaeologi, dan kemudian Sejarah, memperoleh 2:2 (gelar kelas dua yang lebih rendah). Charles merupakan anggota pertama dari Keluarga Kerajaan Inggris yang diberikan gelar.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would immediately enter the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and then History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles is the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Inggris telah melewati periode damai yang panjang setelah penaklukan Danelaw. Namun, pada tahun 991 Ethelred dihadapkan dengan armada Viking yang lebih besar dari armada mana pun sejak armada Guthrum seabad sebelumnya. Armada ini dipimpin oleh Olaf Trygvasson, seorang pria Norwegia dengan ambisi merebut kembali negaranya dari kekuasaan Denmark. Setelah kemunduran militer, Ethelred akhirnya mencapai kesepakatan dengan Olaf, yang kembali ke Norwegia untuk mencoba memperoleh kerajaannya dengan hasil berbeda-beda.
mt: 991 AD: England has been at peace for a long time since the conquest of the Danelaw. However, in 991 Ethelred was faced with a larger Viking fleet than any since Guthrum's fleet a century before. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian man with ambitions to retake his country from Danish rule. After a military setback, Ethelred eventually reached an agreement with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to regain his kingdom with varying results.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Sekitar abad ke-15, wilayah utara Estonia mendapat pengaruh budaya yang kuat dari Jerman. Beberapa rahib Jerman ingin mendekatkan Tuhan kepada penduduk asli, jadi mereka menciptakan bahasa harfiah Estonia. ""Bahasa ini dibuat berdasarkan alfabet Jerman dan satu karakter ""Ã•/Ãµ"" pun ditambahkan. "" Seiring berlalunya waktu, banyak kata pinjaman dari Jerman yang menyatu. Ini adalah awal mula pencerahan."
mt: "Sometime in the 15th century, the northern part of Estonia was strongly influenced by German culture. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the natives, so they created a literal Estonian language. This language was based on the German alphabet and one character, ""Ã•/Ãµ"", was added. As time passed, many German loanwords were assimilated. This is the beginning of enlightenment."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Ada berbagai perkiraan tentang berapa banyak orang yang berbicara Bahasa Hindi. Diperkirakan, bahasa ini berada di antara urutan kedua dan keempat dalam peringkat bahasa yang paling umum dipakai di dunia. Jumlah dari penutur asli bervariasi, bergantung pada apakah dialek yang berkaitan erat dihitung atau tidak. Estimasinya berkisar antara 340 juta dan 500 juta penutur, sebanyak 800 juta orang dapat memahami bahasa tersebut. Bahasa Hindi dan Urdu memiliki kosakata yang mirip tetapi aksaranya berbeda; dalam percakapan sehari-hari, penutur kedua bahasa tersebut biasanya bisa saling memahami.
mt: There are various estimates about how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies, depending on whether closely related dialects are counted or not. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, with 800 million people able to understand the language. Hindi and Urdu have similar vocabularies but different scripts; in everyday conversation, speakers of the two languages can usually understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul merupakan satu-satunya alfabet yang sengaja diciptakan untuk digunakan sehari-hari. Alfabet tersebut diciptakan pada 1444 saat masa pemerintahan Raja Sejong (1418 - 1450). Raja Sejong adalah raja keempat dari Dinasti Joseon dan merupakan salah satu yang paling dihormati. ""Awalnya dia menamai alfabet Hangeul sebagai Hunmin Jeongeum, yang berarti ""suara yang benar untuk instruksi rakyat""."""
mt: "Hangeul is the only alphabet that was intentionally created for everyday use. The alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 - 1450). King Sejong was the fourth ruler of the Joseon Dynasty and one of the most respected. ""Initially he named the alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""correct sounds for the instruction of the people."""""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Ada banyak teori mengenai bagaimana Sansekerta tercipta. Salah satunya adalah tentang migrasi bangsa Arya dari barat ke India yang membawa bahasa mereka bersama mereka. Bahasa Sansekerta adalah bahasa kuno dan sebanding dengan bahasa Latin yang digunakan di Eropa. Buku paling awal yang dikenal di dunia ditulis dalam Bahasa Sanskerta. Setelah kompilasi Upanishad, bahasa Sansekerta memudar begitu saja akibat adanya hierarki. Sanskerta adalah bahasa yang sangat kompleks dan kaya, yang merupakan sumber berbagai macam bahasa India modern, sama seperti bahasa Latin yang menjadi sumber bahasa Eropa seperti Prancis dan Spanyol.
mt: There are many theories about how Sanskrit came to be. One of them is about the migration of the Aryans from the west to India, bringing their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient and equivalent to Latin used in Europe. The oldest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of the Upanishads, Sanskrit faded away due to the hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which is the source of many Indian modern languages, just as Latin is the source of European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Bagaimana gravitasi Io menarik saya? Jika Anda berdiri di permukaan Io, Anda akan berbobot lebih ringan dibanding saat berada di Bumi. Orang yang berbobot 90 kg di Bumi akan berbobot 16 kg di Io. Itu sebabnya gravitasi memiliki daya tarik lebih rendah.
mt: How does Io's gravity pull me? If you stand on the surface of Io, you will weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 90 kg on Earth will weigh 16 kg on Io. That's why gravity has a weaker pull.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Permukaan Bulan tersusun dari bebatuan dan debu. Lapisan terluar Bulan dinamakan kerak. Tebal keraknya sekitar 70 km di sisi terdekat dan 100 km di sisi terjauh. Ini lebih tipis di bawah maria dan lebih tebal di bawah dataran tinggi. Kemungkinan ada lebih banyak area gelap di sisi dekat karena keraknya lebih tipis. Lahar lebih mudah naik ke permukaan.
mt: The Moon's surface is composed of rocks and dust. The outermost layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under maria and thicker under highlands. There may be more dark areas on the near side because the crust is thinner. Lava is easier to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Banyak orang memimpikan hari ketika manusia dapat melakukan perjalanan ke bintang lain dan menjelajahi dunia lain, beberapa orang bertanya-tanya ada apa di luar sana, beberapa orang percaya bahwa makhluk asing atau kehidupan lain mungkin hidup di planet lain. ""Namun, kalau ini terjadi, mungkin tidak akan dalam waktu yang sangat lama. Bintang-bintang sangat tersebar sehingga jarak antara bintang-bintang yang ""bertetangga"" mencapai triliunan kilometer."" Mungkin suatu hari, cicit Anda akan berdiri di dunia alien berusaha membayangkan seperti apa nenek moyang zaman purba mereka?"
mt: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to other stars and explore other worlds, some wonder what is out there, some believe that alien life or other life may live on other planets. "However, if this happens, it will not be for a very long time. Stars are so scattered that the distance between neighboring stars reaches trillions of kilometers." One day, your grandchildren will stand on an alien world trying to imagine what their ancestors looked like in the distant past?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Matahari tidak memiliki kerak seperti Bumi yang bisa Anda pijak. Seluruh bagian Matahari terbuat dari gas, api, dan plasma. Gas menjadi lebih tipis saat Anda semakin jauh dari pusat Matahari. Bagian luar yang kita lihat ketika kita melihat Matahari disebut fotosfer, yang artinya ""bola cahaya""."
mt: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like Earth that you can walk on. The whole Sun is made of gas, fire, and plasma. Gas gets thinner the farther you get from the Sun's center. The part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light."""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Sekitar tiga ribu tahun kemudian, pada tahun 1610, astronom Italia Galileo Galilei menggunakan teleskop untuk mengamati bahwa Venus mempunyai fase, sebagaimana halnya bulan. Fase terjadi karena hanya sisi Venus (atau dari sisi Bulan) yang menghadap Matahari mendapat pencahayaan. Fase Venus mendukung teori dari Copernicus yang menyatakan bahwa planet mengitari Matahari. Selanjutnya, beberapa tahun kemudian pada tahun 1639, astronom Inggris bernama Jeremiah Horrocks mengamati transit Venus.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus had phases, as the Moon does. Phases occur because only the side of Venus (or the side of the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that planets orbit the Sun. Later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Sungai Amazon adalah sungai terpanjang kedua dan terbesar pertama di Bumi. Sungai ini membawa air 8x lebih banyak dari sungai terbesar kedua. Amazon juga merupakan sungai paling luas di dunia, dengan lebar sekitar 9,6 kilometer. Sebanyak 20 persen air yang mengalir dari berbagai sungai ke samudra-samudra di planet ini berasal dari Amazon. Sungai Amazon utama sepanjang 6.387 km (3.980 mil). Sungai tersebut menampung air dari ribuan sungai kecil.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and first largest river in the world. The Amazon carries 8 times more water than the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world, with a width of about 9.6 kilometers. Twenty percent of the water that flows from various rivers into the oceans of the planet comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. The river collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Delapan belas persen warga Venezuela menganggur, sedangkan sebagian besar pekerja yang ada bekerja di ekonomi informal. Dari dua per tiga warga Venezuela yang bekerja di sektor jasa, hampir satu per empat bekerja di industri dan satu per lima di pertanian. Industri penting bagi warga Venezuela adalah minyak, komoditas ekspor negara ini, walau hanya satu persen penduduk yang bekerja di industri minyak.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, while most of the employed work in the informal economy. Of the two-thirds of Venezuelans who work in the service sector, almost one-fourth work in industry and one-fifth in agriculture. The important industry for Venezuelans is oil, a commodity exported by the country, although only one percent of the population works in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Bintang memberikan cahaya dan panas, sebab energi yang tercipta saat atom hidrogen bergabung (atau fusi) membentuk elemen yang lebih berat. Ilmuwan sedang bekerja menciptakan reaktor yang bisa menghasilkan energi dengan cara yang sama. Ini, bagaimanapun, adalah masalah yang sangat sulit untuk dipecahkan dan akan memakan waktu bertahun-tahun sebelum kita melihat reaktor fusi yang berguna dibangun.
mt: Stars give off light and heat, because the energy created when hydrogen atoms combine (or fuse) to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can produce energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take years before we see a useful fusion reactor built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

Ilmuwan sedang bekerja menciptakan reaktor yang bisa menghasilkan energi dengan cara yang sama. Ini, bagaimanapun, adalah masalah yang sangat sulit untuk dipecahkan dan akan memakan waktu bertahun-tahun sebelum kita melihat reaktor fusi yang berguna dibangun.
mt: Stars give off light and heat, because the energy created when hydrogen atoms combine (or fuse) to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can produce energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take years before we see a useful fusion reactor built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elemen dan senyawa bisa bergerak dari kondisi satu ke lainnya dan tidak berubah. Nitrogen sebagai gas masih memiliki sifat yang sama dengan nitrogen cair. Kondisi cairnya lebih padat, tetapi molekulnya masih sama. Air ialah contoh lainnya. Air senyawa tersusun dari dua atom hidrogen dan satu atom oksigen. Ini memiliki struktur molekul yang sama baik itu gas, zat cair, maupun benda padat. Walau bentuk fisiknya mungkin berubah, tetapi bentuk kimiawinya kan tetap sama.
mt: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. Its liquid state is denser, but its molecules are still the same. Water is another example. Water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical form may change, its chemical form will still be the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Selama Perang Revolusi, tiga belas negara bagian pertama-tama membentuk sebuah pemerintah pusat yang lemah â€” dengan Kongres sebagai satu-satunya komponen â€” di bawah Pasal-Pasal Konfederasi. Kongres tidak mempunyai kekuasaan untuk mengenakan pajak. Karena tidak ada eksekutif atau yudikatif nasional, Kongres mengandalkan otoritas negara bagian, yang sering kali tidak kooperatif, untuk menegakkan semua tindakannya. Ia juga tidak memiliki otoritas untuk mengesampingkan peraturan pajak dan tarif antar negara bagian. Pasal-pasal tersebut memerlukan kesepakatan suara yang bulat dari semua negara bagian sebelum dapat diubah, sedangkan negara-negara bagian tidak mengindahkan pemerintah pusat sehingga perwakilan mereka sering tidak hadir.
mt: During the Revolution, thirteen states first formed a weak central government â€” with Congress as the only component â€” under the Articles of Confederation. Congress had no power to levy taxes. Because there was no executive or judiciary, Congress relied on the authority of the states, which were often uncooperative, to enforce all of its actions. It also lacked authority to override state tax and tariff regulations. The Articles required unanimous consent of all states before they could be amended, while the states ignored the central government so that their representatives often did not attend.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Jika Anda pernah menonton film National Treasure, Anda mungkin berpikir peta harta karun ditulis di belakang Deklarasi Kemerdekaan. Namun, itu tidak benar. Meskipun ada tulisan di belakangnya, dokumen ini bukan peta harta karun. ""Pada bagian belakang Deklarasi Kemerdekaan terdapat tulisan ""Deklarasi Asli Kemerdekaan tanggal 4 Juli 1776"". Teks muncul di bagian bawah dokumen secara terbalik."" Meskipun tidak ada yang tahu secara pasti siapa yang menulisnya, diketahui bahwa di awal-awal dokumen perkamen yang besar (berukuran 29Â¾ inci kali 24Â½ inci) digulung agar bisa disimpan. Jadi, notasi itu kemungkinan besar disisipkan cuma sebagai label."
mt: "If you've ever seen the movie National Treasure, you might think the treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. But that's not true. Although there is writing on the back, this document is not a treasure map. ""On the back of the Declaration of Independence there is writing ""Original Declaration of Independence July 4, 1776"". The text appears reversed at the bottom of the document."" Although it is not known for certain who wrote it, it is known that at the beginning of the large parchment document (29¾ inches by 24½ inches) it was rolled up to be stored. So, the notation was probably just inserted as a label."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Di awal-awal kemerdekaan, ahli Kebun Raya Singapura membantu transformasi pulau tersebut menjadi Kota Kebun tropis. Pada tahun 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, sebuah hibrida anggrek, dipilih sebagai bunga nasional bangsa.
mt: In the early days of independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Di awal-awal kemerdekaan, ahli Kebun Raya Singapura membantu transformasi pulau tersebut menjadi Kota Kebun tropis. Pada tahun 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, sebuah hibrida anggrek, dipilih sebagai bunga nasional bangsa.
mt: In the early days of independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Walau pembangunan piramida dengan batu berlanjut sampai dengan akhir dari Kerajaan Lama, ukuran dan kesempurnaan teknik dari konstruksi piramida Giza tidak pernah terlampaui. Kerajaan Baru Mesir kuno mengagumi monumen para pendahulunya, yang saat itu berusia lebih dari seribu tahun.
mt: While the construction of pyramids with stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the size and perfection of the construction techniques of the Giza pyramids were never surpassed. The New Kingdom of ancient Egypt admired the monuments of its predecessors, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Setiap tahun sekitar bulan Oktober, hampir 1,5 juta herbivora melakukan perjalanan menuju dataran selatan, menyeberangi Sungai Mara, dari perbukitan utara untuk mendatangi musim hujan. Lalu, herbivora ini kembali ke utara melalui arah barat, menyeberangi sungai Mara sekali lagi, setelah turun hujan sekitar bulan April. Wilayah Serengeti terdiri dari Taman Nasional Serengeti, Kawasan Konservasi Ngorongoro, dan Maswa Game Reserve di Tanzania, serta Cagar Alam Nasional Maasai Mara di Kenya.
mt: Every year around October, nearly 1.5 million herbivores make a journey to the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills to visit the rainy season. Then, herbivores return to the north via the west, crossing the Mara River again, after the rainy season around April. The Serengeti area consists of Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area, and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania, and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "Dengan selesainya pertempuran Prancis, Jerman mulai bersiap-siap menginvasi Pulau Britania. ""Jerman menamakan serangan mereka ""Operasi Singa Laut"". Sebagian besar senjata berat dan suplai Tentara Inggris hilang saat evakuasi dari Dunkirk, jadi tentara mereka cukup lemah. "" ""Namun, Angkatan Laut Kerajaan masih jauh lebih kuat daripada Angkatan Laut Jerman (""Kriegsmarine"") dan bisa saja menghancurkan armada invasi yang dikirim menyebrangi Selat Inggris."" Namun, sangat sedikit kapal Angkatan Laut Inggris yang bermarkas di dekat kemungkinan jalur invasi karena para laksamana takut kapal mereka tenggelam akibat serangan udara Jerman."
mt: "Upon the conclusion of the French campaign, Germany began preparing to invade the British Isles.  ""Germany named their attack ""Operation Sea Lion"".  ""Most of the heavy weapons and supplies of the British Army were lost during the evacuation from Dunkirk, so their army was weak.  ""However, the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (""Kriegsmarine"") and could possibly destroy the invasion fleet crossing the English Channel."" However, very few Royal Navy ships were stationed near the likely invasion route because the admirals were afraid their ships would be sunk by German air attacks."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "Mari mulai dengan penjelasan tentang rencana Italia. Italia pada dasarnya adalah ""adik laki-laki"" dari Jerman dan Jepang. Ini memiliki tentara yang lebih lemah dan angkatan laut yang lebih lemah, meskipun mereka baru saja membangun empat kapal baru tepat sebelum dimulainya perang. Sasaran utama Italia ialah negara-negara Afrika. Untuk merebut negara-negara tersebut, mereka perlu memiliki landasan peluncuran pasukan, supaya pasukan bisa berlayar melintasi Laut Mediterania dan menginvasi Afrika. Untuk itu, mereka harus menyingkirkan pangkalan dan kapal Britania di Mesir. Selain tindakan itu, kapal perang Italia tidak seharusnya melakukan hal lain. Sekarang Jepang. Jepang adalah negara daratan, sama seperti Britania."
mt: "Let's start with the Italian plan. Italy is basically the "older brother" of Germany and Japan. It has a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they have just built four new ships just before the war started. Their main target is the African countries. To conquer these countries, they need to have a staging area for their troops, so that the troops can sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. To do this, they need to remove the British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides this action, Italian ships should not do anything else. Now Japan. Japan is a landlocked country, just like Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."
